Animated Armor (BB).name: Armadura animada (BB)
Animated Armor (BB).acDetails: (13 después de que la armadura de construcción se rompa), construir armadura
Animated Armor (BB).publicNotes:
A los objetos se les puede dar una apariencia de vida mediante el uso de rituales u otra magia extraña, convirtiéndolos en objetos animados. Estos objetos se mueven, trabajan y luchan según las órdenes que les dan sus creadores, quienes generalmente los ponen en guardia o les hacen realizar trabajos de baja categoría.

Las armaduras animadas pueden servir como guardianes, pero a veces las academias marciales de alto nivel los utilizan como compañeros de entrenamiento. Se encuentran con mayor frecuencia en los laboratorios de los magos.y mazmorras antiguas.

action->Construct Armor.name: Construir armadura
action->Construct Armor.description: La armadura animada reduce todo el daño que recibe en 9. Sin embargo, después de un golpe crítico que causa daño, o después de que su HP cae por debajo de 10, su armadura construida se rompe. Su CA baja a 13 y ya no reduce el daño en 9.

Basilisk (BB).name: Basilisco (BB)
Basilisk (BB).publicNotes: Un basilisco es un reptil de ocho patas que puede convertir criaturas en piedra con solo mirarlas.

action->Petrifying Glance.name: Mirada petrificante
action->Petrifying Glance.description:
Cuando una criatura que el basilisco puede ver dentro de 30 pies comienza su turno, el basilisco puede usar su reacción para mirar a la criatura.

La criatura debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:20]. Si falla, gana la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1} durante 1 minuto mientras su cuerpo se pone rígido lentamente.

action->Petrifying Gaze.name: Mirada petrificante
action->Petrifying Gaze.description:
El basilisco mira fijamente a una criatura que puede ver a menos de 30 pies. Si la criatura puede ver el basilisco, esa criatura debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22].

Si falla y aún no ha obtenido la condición de ralentización de Mirada petrificante o esta habilidad, obtiene la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Lentificado 1}. Si la criatura falla esta salvación cuando ya tiene la condición de ralentización de esta habilidad o Mirada Petrificante, la criatura se convierte permanentemente en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dTwPJuKgBQCMxixg]{Stone} .

Una criatura petrificada de esta manera que está cubierta con sangre fresca de basilisco vuelve instantáneamente a la carne. Un solo basilisco contiene suficiente sangre para cubrir hasta 2 criaturas de esta manera.

Boar (BB).name: Jabalí (BB)
Boar (BB).publicNotes: De mal genio y duros, los jabalíes son mucho más peligrosos que los cerdos domesticados. Estos mamíferos omnívoros son cazados intensamente porque su carne se considera un manjar. Es más probable que los jabalíes ataquen a los humanoides en defensa propia o durante su temporada de apareamiento en los meses de invierno, cuando a los machos les crece una pulgada extra de tejido para proteger sus órganos mientras luchan contra sus rivales. En algunas culturas, los jabalíes son entrenados para volverse mucho más agresivos y usarlos como bestias de guerra y guardianes. cuando talLos jabalíes regresan a la naturaleza y pueden convertirse en verdaderos terrores de la región.

action->Ferocity.name: Ferocity
action->Ferocity.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.N1kstYbHScxgUQtN]

Cuando el jabalí se reduce a 0 Puntos de Vida, puede usar su reacción para permanecer consciente con 1 Punto de Vida, pero gana la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Herido 1} (o aumenta su valor de herido en 1 si ya tiene esa condición). No puede usar esta habilidad en herido 3.

action->Boar Charge.name: Carga de jabalí
action->Boar Charge.description: El jabalí da dos zancadas y luego realiza un golpe con un colmillo. Mientras se haya movido al menos 20 pies, obtiene un bonificador de circunstancia +2 a su tirada de ataque.

Brine Shark (BB).name: Tiburón de salmuera (BB)
Brine Shark (BB).publicNotes:
Los elementales de agua deambulan por los infinitos océanos del Plano del Agua. Pueden traerse al mundo mediante magia de invocación o mediante desastres naturales como inundaciones o huracanes. Aunque los elementales del agua pueden ser muy destructivos, no siempre son maliciosos. Así como el agua puede dar vida a quienes la necesitan, sus olas pueden golpear las costas y sus lluvias inundar las ciudades. Los elementales del agua son igualmente difíciles de predecir.

Tiburones salmuera, feroces pero entre las aguas más débileselementales, toman formas que se asemejan a tiburones hechos enteramente de agua. Cuando se encuentran, generalmente están solos o siguiendo las órdenes de un lanzador de hechizos que los convocó a este plano.

action->Deep Plunge.name: Inmersión profunda
action->Deep Plunge.description: El tiburón salmuera se sumerge directamente en el agua, nadando hasta 100 pies en línea vertical recta. Puede usar esta habilidad mientras @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbing} una criatura.

action->Grab.name: Grab
action->Grab.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]

Cuando el tiburón de salmuera logra golpear con sus mandíbulas, puede usar esta acción inmediatamente después para darle automáticamente al objetivo la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado} hasta el final de su siguiente turno.

Bugbear Prowler (BB).name: Bugbear Prowler (BB)
Bugbear Prowler (BB).publicNotes: Estas criaturas sigilosas y crueles se deleitan en sembrar miedo y atormentar a sus víctimas. Los osgos son los monstruos que acechan en el armario y se esconden debajo de la cama. Los osos insecto, que se alimentan de granjas remotas, revelan su presencia con golpes en la noche o crujidos de tablas, inspirando temor, sospecha y miedo en aquellos a quienes atormentan.

weapon->Javelin.name: Javelin
weapon->Javelin.description: This thin spear is well balanced for throwing but is not designed for melee use.

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Las espadas largas pueden ser espadas de uno o dos filos. Sus hojas son pesadas y miden entre 3 y 4 pies de largo.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Bushwhack.name: Bushwhack
action->Bushwhack.description: The bugbear prowler Strides up to 10 feet and attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature that can't see them and doesn't know where they are. If the bugbear succeeds, they also deal damage from their fist Strike to that creature.

action->Mauler.name: Torturador
action->Mauler.description: The bugbear prowler gains a +3 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Agarrado}.

Caligni Dancer (BB).name: Caligni Dancer (BB)
Caligni Dancer (BB).publicNotes: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

weapon->Mace.name: Mace
weapon->Mace.description: With a stout haft and a heavy metal head, a mace is sturdy and allows its wielder to deliver powerful blows and dent armor.

action->Light Blindness.name: Ceguera a la luz
action->Light Blindness.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

action->Final Dance.name: Final Dance
action->Final Dance.description: When a caligni dancer dies, their body dissolves into a swirl of darkness and light. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:10]{10 feet} must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:17] save or take a -2 circumstance penalty on all attack rolls for 1 round.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

The caligni dancer deals an additional 1d6 damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} creatures.

Caligni Hunter (BB).name: Caligni Hunter (BB)
Caligni Hunter (BB).publicNotes: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

spell->See the Unseen (At Will).name: See the Unseen (At Will)
spell->See the Unseen (At Will).description:
Your gaze pierces through illusions and finds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures and spirits. You can see invisible creatures as though they weren't invisible, although their features are blurred, making them @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} and difficult to identify. You can also see incorporeal creatures, like ghosts, phased through an object from within 10 feet of an object's surface as blurry shapes seen through those objects. Subtler clues also grant you a +2 status bonus to checks you make to disbelieve illusions.

Heightened (5th) This spell has a duration of 8 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.T5bk6UH7yuYog1Fp]{Spell Effect: See the Unseen}

spell->Figment.name: Figment
spell->Figment.description: You create a simple illusory sound or vision. A sound adds the auditory trait to the spell and the sound can't include intelligible words or elaborate music. A vision adds the visual trait, can be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and is clearly crude and undetailed if viewed from within 15 feet. When you Cast or Sustain the Spell, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} with the illusion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your Deception check. If the attempt fails against a creature, that creature disbelieves the figment.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

action->Light Blindness.name: Ceguera a la luz
action->Light Blindness.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.qCCLZhnp2HhP3Ex6]

The caligni hunter deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} condition.

action->Final Fate.name: Final Fate
action->Final Fate.description: When a caligni hunter dies, their body explodes. All creatures within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} must take @Damage[5d6[fire]]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save.

action->Darkening Poison.name: Darkening Poison
action->Darkening Poison.description: The next time the hunter deals damage with a shortsword Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and treat all creatures as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} for 1 round.

Caligni Skulker (BB).name: Caligni Skulker (BB)
Caligni Skulker (BB).publicNotes: Caligni lurk in subterranean cities, and they relish the chance to creep above ground at night to steal resources, spy on surface dwellers, or simply cause mischief.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

action->Light Blindness.name: Ceguera a la luz
action->Light Blindness.description: When first exposed to bright light, the caligni can't see until the end of their next turn. All squares are difficult terrain for them, and they take a -4 status penalty to Perception. If they try to attack a creature, the attack fails unless they succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Light doesn't blind them again for 1 hour.

action->Final Night.name: Final Night
action->Final Night.description: When a caligni skulker dies, their body dissolves fog of inky darkness. All light sources within @Template[emanation|distance:20]{20 feet} are extinguished. Any light spells in the area go out for 1 round.

action->Darkening Poison.name: Darkening Poison
action->Darkening Poison.description: The next time the skulker deals damage with a dagger Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and treat all creatures as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} for 1 round.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
tag will get replaced with text from compendium entry @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.qCCLZhnp2HhP3Ex6]

The caligni skulker deals an extra 1d6 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} condition.

Central Spears (BB).name: Lanzas centrales (BB)
Central Spears (BB).disable: Un héroe debe tener éxito en una prueba @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|traits:hazard|name:Disable Mechanism] en las losas del piso activadas o en los enchufes de la pared occidental.
Central Spears (BB).reset: Las lanzas centrales se reinician después de 1 minuto.

action->Spear Barrage.name: Aluvión de lanzas
action->Spear Barrage.description: Cuando una criatura se mueve hacia cualquiera de los cuadrados en el área delineada, la trampa dispara tres lanzas desde la pared occidental. Realiza un ataque a distancia contra la criatura más occidental de cada fila.

Cinder Rat (BB).name: Rata de ceniza (BB)
Cinder Rat (BB).publicNotes:
Los elementales de fuego son manifestaciones destructivas del Plano de Fuego. A veces vienen al mundo en lugares poderosos de calor y llamas donde se forman vórtices elementales, como en los volcanes.

Las ratas de ceniza son roedores de gran tamaño hechos de carbón humeante y fuego elemental. De su carne en llamas brotan continuamente vapores nocivos. Al igual que las ratas terrestres, las ratas de ceniza buscan guaridas apartadas y pueden multiplicarse rápidamente si no se controlan.

action->Smoke Vision.name: Visión de humo
action->Smoke Vision.description: La rata de ceniza ignora la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} del humo.

action->Fetid Fumes.name: Humos fétidos
action->Fetid Fumes.description: Una nube de humo rodea a la rata de ceniza. Todas las criaturas dentro de @Template[type:emanation|distance:5]{5 feet}, incluida la rata de ceniza, obtienen la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Oculto} de este humo. Una criatura que se acerque a 5 pies de la rata de ceniza o comience su turno a 5 pies debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:22] o sufrir una penalización de estado de -1 a todas las pruebas y CD durante 1 ronda (Usa @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1} ) .

Doppelganger (BB).name: Doble (BB)
Doppelganger (BB).publicNotes: Los Doppelgangers pueden transformarse en copias perfectas de otras criaturas pero tienen formas indeterminadas en sus estados naturales.

action->End the Charade.name: Poner fin a la farsa
action->End the Charade.description:
Cuando el doble se transforma con Cambiar forma y otra criatura se mueve adyacente a él o usa un Golpe u otra acción hostil contra él, el doble puede usar su reacción para volver a su forma natural y realizar un Golpe contra esa criatura.

Si la criatura no sabía que el doble estaba disfrazado, esa criatura tiene la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} contra este Golpe.

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.eQM5hQ1W3d1uen97]

El doble adopta la apariencia específica de cualquier humanoide Pequeño o Mediano que haya visto. Esto no cambia la velocidad de zancada del doble ni sus bonificaciones de ataque y daño con sus golpes, pero podría cambiar el tipo de daño que causan sus golpes (normalmente contundente).

action->Mind Reading.name: Lectura de la mente
action->Mind Reading.description: El doble intenta leer los pensamientos superficiales de una criatura dentro de un radio de 30 pies. El objetivo resiste si tiene éxito en una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:21].

spell->Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
spell->Dispel Magic.description: You unravel the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. If you successfully counteract a magic item, the item becomes a mundane item of its type for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, you automatically fail.
spell->Dispel Magic.target: 1 spell effect or unattended magic item

spell->Resist Energy.name: Resist Energy
spell->Resist Energy.description:
A shield of elemental energy protects a creature against one type of energy damage. Choose acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic damage. The target and its gear gain resistance 5 against the damage type you chose.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.con2Hzt47JjpuUej]{Spell Effect: Resist Energy}

Heightened (4th) The resistance increases to 10, and you can target up to two creatures.

Heightened (7th) The resistance increases to 15, and you can target up to five creatures.

spell->Command.name: Command
spell->Command.description:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Fear.name: Fear
spell->Fear.description:
You plant fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} for 1 round.

Heightened (3rd) You can target up to five creatures.

spell->Guidance.name: Guidance
spell->Guidance.description:
You ask for divine guidance, granting the target a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check the target attempts before the duration ends. The target chooses which roll to use the bonus on before rolling. If the target uses the bonus, the spell ends. Either way, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3qHKBDF7lrHw8jFK]{Spell Effect: Guidance}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3LyOkV25p7wA181H]{Effect: Guidance Immunity}

spell->Heal.name: Heal
spell->Heal.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

spell->Heal.name: Heal
spell->Heal.description:
You channel vitality energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, you restore 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

3 (material, somatic, verbal) You disperse vitality energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

If the target is undead, you deal that amount of vitality damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions you spend when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.

1 (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.

2 (verbal, somatic) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If you're healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8

Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

spell->Magic Weapon.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TFitdEOpQC4SzKQQ]
Arma mágica
spell->Magic Weapon.description:
The weapon glimmers with magic and energy. The target becomes a +1 striking weapon, gaining a +1 item bonus to attack rolls and increasing the number of weapon damage dice to two.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.GnWkI3T3LYRlm3X8]{Spell Effect: Runic Weapon}
spell->Magic Weapon.target: 1 arma desatendida o empuñada por ti o por un aliado dispuesto

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you.

The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, you can use the spell's reaction against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gKKqvLohtrSJj3BM]{Force Barrage} spell.

Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.

Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.

Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.

Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

spell->Stabilize.name: Stabilize
spell->Stabilize.description: Vitality energy shuts death's door. The target loses the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition, though it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} at 0 Hit Points.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

shield->Shield.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]
Blindaje
shield->Shield.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Un escudo tiene 20 puntos de vida. Si un escudo alguna vez recibe 10 daños o más, se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Roto} . Un escudo roto no se puede usar para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} , pero aún puedes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repair}. Si el escudo pierde los 20 puntos de vida, queda completamente destruido.

armor->Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
armor->Chain Shirt.description: Sometimes called a hauberk, this is a long shirt constructed of the same metal rings as chainmail. However, it is much lighter than chainmail and protects only the torso, upper arms, and upper legs of its wearer.

equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).name: Religious Symbol (Wooden)
equipment->Religious Symbol (Wooden).description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.plplsXJsqrdqNQVI]

Esta pieza de madera o plata está adornada con una imagen que representa una deidad. Algunos lanzadores de conjuros divinos, como los clérigos, pueden utilizar un símbolo religioso de su deidad como foco divino para utilizar ciertas habilidades y lanzar algunos hechizos. Se debe sostener un símbolo religioso en una mano para usarlo.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Light Blindness.name: Light Blindness
action->Light Blindness.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]

Cuando se expone por primera vez a una luz brillante, el drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Todas las casillas son terreno difícil para ellos y sufren una penalización de -4 a su estado de Percepción. Si intentan atacar a una criatura, el ataque falla a menos que tengan éxito en un @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. La luz no los vuelve a cegar durante 1 hora.

action->Shield Block.name: Shield Block
action->Shield Block.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.m4HQ2o5aPxjXf2kY]

Si ella @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raised a Shield} desde su último turno, la sacerdotisa puede gastar su reacción para bloquear un Golpe. Reduce el daño del Golpe en 5, pero luego ella y el escudo reciben el daño restante, posiblemente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3]{Breaking} o destruyen el escudo.

Drow Sneak (BB).name: Furtivo drow (BB)
Drow Sneak (BB).publicNotes: Solitarios de corazón, los drow furtivos no confían en nadie y menos aún en sus compañeros drow. Estos drow dependen de la conciencia y la adaptación para sobrevivir a la naturaleza despiadada de su sociedad.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Light Blindness.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]

Cuando se expone por primera vez a una luz brillante, el drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Todas las casillas son terreno difícil para ellos y sufren una penalización de -4 a su estado de Percepción. Si intentan atacar a una criatura, el ataque falla a menos que tengan éxito en un @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. La luz no los vuelve a cegar durante 1 hora.

action->Quick Draw.name: Dibujo rapido
action->Quick Draw.description: El pícaro drow saca un arma usando la acción Interactuar, luego ataca con esa arma.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

El furtivo drow inflige 1d6 de daño adicional a las criaturas que tienen la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido}.

Drow Warrior (BB).name: Guerrero Drow (BB)
Drow Warrior (BB).publicNotes: Los drow son descendientes de elfos corrompidos por un gran mal cuando huyeron a las profundidades del subsuelo hace mucho tiempo.

weapon->Hand Crossbow.name: Hand Crossbow
weapon->Hand Crossbow.description: Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.

weapon->Rapier.name: Rapier
weapon->Rapier.description: The rapier is a long and thin piercing blade with a basket hilt. It is prized among many as a dueling weapon.

weapon->Dagger.name: Dagger
weapon->Dagger.description: This small, bladed weapon is held in one hand and used to stab a creature in close combat. It can also be thrown.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Bolts.name: Bolts
consumable->Bolts.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

action->Light Blindness.name: Light Blindness
action->Light Blindness.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.I0HYG0ctCLP5JRsW]

Cuando se expone por primera vez a una luz brillante, el drow @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Can't See} hasta el final de su siguiente turno. Todas las casillas son terreno difícil para ellos y sufren una penalización de -4 a su estado de Percepción. Si intentan atacar a una criatura, el ataque falla a menos que tengan éxito en un @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. La luz no los vuelve a cegar durante 1 hora.

action->Quick Draw.name: Dibujo rapido
action->Quick Draw.description: El guerrero drow saca un arma usando la acción Interactuar, luego ataca con esa arma.

action->Skewer.name: Brocheta
action->Skewer.description: El guerrero drow ataca con su estoque y obtiene un bono de circunstancia +1 a la tirada de ataque. Si tienen éxito, el objetivo toma @Damage[1d6[bleed]].

Envenomed Lock (BB).name: Cerradura envenenada (BB)
Envenomed Lock (BB).description: Un lomo envenenado con resorte está escondido cerca del ojo de la cerradura de una cerradura. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disabling} o romper la trampa no desactiva ni rompe el bloqueo.
Envenomed Lock (BB).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:17|traits:hazard|name:Disable the Spring Mechanism] en el mecanismo de resorte

action->Spring.name: Primavera
action->Spring.description: Cuando una criatura intenta desbloquear o forzar la cerradura, una columna se extiende para atacar a esa criatura con un ataque de columna.

Falling Ceiling (BB).name: Techo que cae (BB)
Falling Ceiling (BB).disable: Un héroe debe tener éxito en una prueba @Check[type:thievery|dc:18|traits:hazard|name:Prevent Blocks from Falling] en la casilla activadora o en el techo para evitar que los bloques de piedra caigan.

action->Falling Stones.name: Piedras que caen
action->Falling Stones.description: Cuando una criatura pisa el cuadrado más cercano a la puerta norte, la trampa deja caer bloques de piedra a lo largo del pasillo. Realiza un golpe a distancia contra cada criatura entre las dos puertas.

Forest Troll (BB).name: Forest Troll (BB)
Forest Troll (BB).publicNotes: Forest trolls are dim-witted, gangly giants who stalk the fringes of civilization. They rely on their incredible strength to overpower foes with their vicious claws. A troll's endless hunger drives them to consume a variety of living creatures. Trolls stand anywhere from 12 to 16 feet tall, though they prefer to hunch to lull foes into a false sense of security.

action->Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by.name: Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by Electricity or Fire)
action->Regeneration 20 (Deactivated by.description: The troll regains 20 Hit Points at the start of their turn unless they've taken electricity or fire damage since their last turn. The troll can't die unless their regeneration is deactivated when they're reduced to 0 HP.

action->Easily Misled.name: Easily Misled
action->Easily Misled.description: The forest troll gets a -4 circumstance penalty to their Perception DC against deception checks.

action->Rend.name: Rend
action->Rend.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.3JOi2cMcGhT3eze1]

Si el troll tiene éxito en dos golpes de garra contra la misma criatura en el mismo turno, puede usar esta habilidad para infligir automáticamente daño de golpe de garra a esa criatura.

Gargoyle (BB).name: Gárgola (BB)
Gargoyle (BB).publicNotes:
Las gárgolas son cazadores monstruosos hechos enteramente de piedra. Parecen estatuas decorativas y las utilizan como camuflaje para esconderse a plena vista en las ciudades durante el día y atacar a los desafortunados peatones por la noche. Su forma más común es la de un humanoide con cuernos y alas de murciélago, pero las gárgolas individuales varían mucho, algunas parecen más o menos humanoides y otras se parecen a algo completamente distinto.

Aunque la mayoría caza sola, a veces formanen grupos llamados "alas". Todas las estatuas monstruosas que se encuentran en lo alto de un edificio antiguo podrían ser en realidad gárgolas vivientes.

action->Clawed Feet.name: Pies con garras
action->Clawed Feet.description: Si la gárgola está volando y una criatura se mueve a un cuadrado adyacente debajo de ella, la gárgola puede usar su reacción para realizar un golpe de garra contra esa criatura.

action->Statue.name: Estatua
action->Statue.description: Hasta la próxima vez que usan una acción, la gárgola parece ser una estatua. Una criatura debe superar una prueba @Check[type:perception|dc:32] para descubrir que la estatua es realmente una criatura.

action->Site Bound.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]
Vinculado al sitio
action->Site Bound.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.BcSlVpaN72LoQ5BV]

Un fantasma no puede desviarse más de 120 pies del lugar donde fue asesinado o del lugar que frecuenta. Algunos están vinculados a elementos o criaturas que eran especiales para ellos en lugar de una ubicación.

action->Incorporeal.name: Incorpóreo
action->Incorporeal.description: Un fantasma no tiene cuerpo y puede atravesar objetos físicos, aunque no puede terminar su turno dentro de uno. La mayoría de las pruebas que usan Fuerza y ​​requieren un cuerpo, como @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} y ​​@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, no funcionan contra un fantasma, y ​​un fantasma no puede intentar tales pruebas.

action->Rejuvenation.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]
Rejuvenecimiento
action->Rejuvenation.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.unR8VVR4yyRnsmnB]

Corregir la injusticia que llevó a la muerte del fantasma le permite pasar a la otra vida. De lo contrario, cuando es destruido, el fantasma se vuelve a formar después de [[/br 2d4 #Rejuvenation]]{2d4 days} dentro de la ubicación a la que está destinado, completamente curado.

action->Frightful Moan.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.aiwlPSmNY9b6Psvd]
Gemido espantoso
action->Frightful Moan.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.aiwlPSmNY9b6Psvd]

Cada criatura viviente dentro de @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} que escuche al fantasma debe intentar una salvación @Check[type:will|dc:21]. En caso de fallo, una criatura gana la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 2} (o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Asustado 3} en caso de fallo crítico).

Si tiene éxito, una criatura no puede verse afectada por el Gemido espantoso de este fantasma durante 1 minuto.

Ghoul Stalker (BB).name: Ghoul Stalker (BB)
Ghoul Stalker (BB).publicNotes: The flesh-eating undead, known as ghouls, haunt sinister locations such as lonely graveyards and ruined crypts, making meals of corpses. Legends say that those captured by ghouls hear foul whispers that curse them into craving raw meat, eventually turning them into ghouls.

action->Stench.name: Hedor
action->Stench.description: A creature that comes within 10 feet of the ghoul and can smell the ghoul must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Indispuesto 1}). A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any ghoul's stench for 1 minute.

action->Consume Flesh.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23]
Consumir carne
action->Consume Flesh.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.ixPqVlqLaYTB1b23]

El ghoul devora un trozo de una criatura que murió en la última hora y recupera [[/r 1d6[healing]]] Puntos de vida.

El ghoul puede recuperar puntos de vida de un cuerpo determinado sólo una vez.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Ataque furtivo
action->Sneak Attack.description: The ghoul stalker deals an extra 1d4 damage to creatures that have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} condition.

action->Swift Leap.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-family-ability-glossary.Item.UU1Fp3PRuTFONjC9]
Salto veloz
action->Swift Leap.description: The ghoul jumps up to half its Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Giant Ant (BB).name: Giant Ant (BB)
Giant Ant (BB).publicNotes: Giant ants form vast underground colonies, excavating deep burrows or infesting existing caverns. Giant ants look identical to their smaller kin, but their size makes them a deadly threat to farms and travelers alike.

action->Giant Ant Venom.name: Giant Ant Venom
action->Giant Ant Venom.description: A target that takes piercing damage from the giant ant's stinger Strike must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect] save or take @Damage[1d10[poison]] damage.

action->Haul Away.name: Haul Away
action->Haul Away.description: If the giant ant has a creature grabbed or restrained with its mandibles, it can spend this action to Stride up to its speed, carrying the creature with it. At the end of the Stride, place the creature in any open square adjacent to the giant ant.

Giant Centipede (BB).name: Ciempiés gigante (BB)
Giant Centipede (BB).publicNotes:
Los ciempiés son artrópodos relativamente comunes que viven, cazan y hurgan entre estiércol y detritos. Corriendo a una velocidad sorprendente sobre las decenas de patas unidas a sus cuerpos largos y segmentados, los ciempiés atacan con mandíbulas envenenadas.

La mayoría de los ciempiés gigantes (conocidos como ciempiés de alcantarilla cuando se encuentran en las ciudades) anidan en pequeños grupos pero cazan solos. Los intentos de domesticar ciempiés gigantes para usarlos como guardianes o mascotas generalmente terminan mal, pero algunos duendes yLas sociedades kobold han desarrollado métodos eficaces para utilizar estas alimañas como guardianes. Algunas sociedades asan y comen ciempiés, a menudo con pimientos picantes, como un manjar sabroso, aunque se debe tener cuidado al preparar la comida para evitar contaminar la carne con el veneno de la criatura.

action->Giant Centipede Venom.name: Veneno de ciempiés gigante
action->Giant Centipede Venom.description: Un objetivo que recibe daño penetrante del ataque de las mandíbulas del ciempiés debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14] o recibir @Damage[1d10[poison]] de daño.

Giant Rat (BB).name: Rata gigante (BB)
Giant Rat (BB).publicNotes:
Las ratas gigantes son versiones enormes de las alimañas comunes. Por lo general, se encuentran en cantidades abundantes, pero como no caben en los rincones donde normalmente se esconden las ratas comunes, son mucho más fáciles de localizar y exterminar. De hecho, encontrar y matar una rata gigante es un rito de iniciación para muchos aventureros. Estas tareas se vuelven aburridas rápidamente, por lo que muchos veteranos subcontratan el exterminio a nuevos aventureros.

Las ratas gigantes viven principalmente en alcantarillas donde pueden hurgar en la basuradesde las calles de arriba, pero algunas familias de ratas gigantes viven en lugares más remotos, como cuevas húmedas, bosques o colinas. Las ratas son supervivientes increíblemente hábiles y se pueden encontrar en casi cualquier parte del mundo, aunque tienden a preferir los climas templados o cálidos en lugar de las regiones frías.

Aunque su mordedura por sí sola no es letal excepto para los muy débiles, algunas ratas gigantes son portadoras de una peligrosa enfermedad común a los roedores de todo el mundo: una pestilencia más que capaz de devastarcomunidades rurales. Las ratas son meros portadores sin riesgo de sucumbir a la enfermedad.

Giant Spider (BB).name: Araña gigante (BB)
Giant Spider (BB).publicNotes: Pocas alimañas cotidianas inspiran tanto temor como la infame araña. Las arañas gigantes varían en tamaño. Las versiones de tamaño humano, a veces llamadas arañas cazadoras, son el tipo más común de araña gigante, aunque no las más grandes.

action->Descend on a Web.name: Descender en una Web
action->Descend on a Web.description: La araña gigante se mueve hacia abajo hasta 40 pies, suspendida por una red. Puede colgarse de la web o caerse. La distancia que desciende en una red no cuenta para el daño por caída. Una criatura puede golpear la red, que tiene CA 20 y 8 HP. Si la red se reduce a 0 HP, la araña cae.

action->Giant Spider Venom.name: Veneno de araña gigante
action->Giant Spider Venom.description: Un objetivo dañado por los colmillos de la araña debe tener éxito en una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16] o recibir @Damage[1d12[poison]] daño y obtener la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} durante 1 ronda.

action->Web Trap.name: Trampa web
action->Web Trap.description: Una criatura golpeada por la telaraña gigante Strike queda atrapada en la superficie más cercana. No puede moverse hasta que logre exitosamente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (CD 17).

Giant Viper (BB).name: Víbora gigante (BB)
Giant Viper (BB).publicNotes:
Las serpientes vienen en una variedad de formas, desde constrictoras que habitan en la jungla y que envuelven a sus presas hasta víboras venenosas con mordeduras mortales. De todos modos, todas las serpientes consumen a sus presas enteras desquiciando sus mandíbulas y usando músculos poderosos para mover la comida por sus gargantas y estómagos.

Los colmillos de la víbora gigante, casi tan largos como dagas, inspiran miedo fácilmente. El veneno inyectado por una víbora gigante puede causar una severa coagulación de la sangre y causar tremendosdaño.

action->Coiled Opportunity.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]
Oportunidad enrollada
action->Coiled Opportunity.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]

Si la víbora gigante está enrollada y una criatura se mueve hacia o a través de un cuadrado adyacente a ella, la víbora gigante puede usar su reacción para hacer un Golpe con los colmillos contra esa criatura.

action->Coil.name: Bobina
action->Coil.description: La víbora gigante utiliza una acción para enrollarse. Mientras está enrollado, puede apuntar a una criatura a una distancia de hasta 10 pies con sus colmillos. Después de que la víbora gigante golpea con sus colmillos, se desenrosca.

action->Giant Viper Venom.name: Veneno de víbora gigante
action->Giant Viper Venom.description: Un objetivo dañado por los colmillos de la serpiente debe superar una salvación @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17] o sufrir @Damage[1d12[poison]] daño.

Goblin Commando (BB).name: Comando duende (BB)
Goblin Commando (BB).publicNotes:
La mayoría de las comunidades de duendes se tambalean en un estado de desorden apenas controlado: un colectivo de criaturas que operan en gran medida por instinto rara vez sigue una dirección clara. Incluso los líderes duendes tienden a ser impulsivos, irresponsables y, en general, no son tan buenos liderando.

En teoría, los comandos goblin lideran las incursiones goblin. En la práctica, los comandos goblin rara vez continúan liderando a sus camaradas una vez que la batalla ha comenzado. La mayoría elude sus responsabilidades a favorde entrar en la refriega y reclamar la gloria de sus parientes.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

weapon->Greatsword.name: Greatsword
weapon->Greatsword.description: This immense two-handed sword is nearly as tall as its wielder. Its lower blade is often somewhat dulled to allow it to be gripped for extra leverage in close-quarter fights.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Duende Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description: Si un aliado goblin finaliza una acción de movimiento adyacente al comando goblin, el comando puede usar su reacción para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step} .

Goblin Igniter (BB).name: Encendedor de duendes (BB)
Goblin Igniter (BB).publicNotes:
Los duendes encuentran el fuego totalmente fascinante. Hace luz. Es genial para cocinar. ¡Es un juguete divertido! Algunos duendes llevan la admiración de su gente por el fuego demasiado lejos y la llevan al reino de la obsesión mortal.

Los duendes que centran su atención en la magia para aprender a hacer fuego de la nada se conocen como encendedores de duendes. Estos fanáticos de las llamas pueden ser de gran ayuda para una banda de asaltantes goblin ansiosos por quemar a sus enemigos y causar estragos. Más a menudo, sin embargo,su presencia es un arma de doble filo. En el calor del momento, los encendedores goblin a veces pierden de vista sus objetivos y simplemente prenden fuego a cualquier cosa que pueda arder, ¡incluidos sus propios aliados!

spell->Breathe Fire.name: Breathe Fire
spell->Breathe Fire.description:
A gout of flame sprays from your mouth. You deal 2d6 fire damage to creatures in the area with a basic Reflex save.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Breathe Fire.name: Breathe Fire
spell->Breathe Fire.description:
A gout of flame sprays from your mouth. You deal 2d6 fire damage to creatures in the area with a basic Reflex save.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Breathe Fire.name: Breathe Fire
spell->Breathe Fire.description:
A gout of flame sprays from your mouth. You deal 2d6 fire damage to creatures in the area with a basic Reflex save.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6.

spell->Light.name: Light
spell->Light.description:
The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If you cast this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.cVVZXNbV0nElVOPZ]{Spell Effect: Light}

Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).
spell->Light.target: 1 objeto de 1 volumen o menos, ya sea desatendido o poseído por ti o por un aliado dispuesto

spell->Tangle Vine.name: Tangle Vine
spell->Tangle Vine.description:
A vine appears from thin air, flicking from your hand and lashing itself to the target. Attempt a spell attack roll against the target.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.TwtUIEyenrtAbeiX]{Spell Effect: Tangle Vine}

Critical Success The target gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} against your spell DC to remove the penalty and the immobilized condition.

Success The target takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds for 1 round. It can attempt to Escape against your spell DC to remove the penalty.

Failure The target is unaffected.

Heightened (2nd) The effects last for 2 rounds.

Heightened (4th) The effects last for 1 minute.

spell->Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
spell->Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal 2d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

equipment->Torch.name: Torch
equipment->Torch.description: A torch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 20 feet) for 1 hour. It can be used as an improvised weapon that deals 1d4 bludgeoning damage plus 1 fire damage.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Duende Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description: Si un aliado goblin finaliza una acción de movimiento adyacente al encendedor goblin, el encendedor puede usar su reacción para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step} .

Goblin Warrior (BB).name: Guerrero duende (BB)
Goblin Warrior (BB).publicNotes:
Los luchadores de primera línea de las tribus goblin prefieren luchar en grupos grandes, especialmente cuando pueden superar en número a sus enemigos al menos tres a uno. No se necesita un entrenamiento intenso ni una gran dureza para convertirse en un guerrero goblin. Cualquiera puede aspirar a este puesto o ser reclutado para desempeñarlo durante una emergencia.

Los guerreros duendes disfrutan causando estragos. No piensan en sacrificar ganado, robar niños o quemar edificios simplemente por deleite momentáneo.Se deleitan jugando trucos maliciosos a humanoides más altos, a quienes llaman "longshanks". Lo que a los goblins les falta en coherencia, planificación a largo plazo y buen sentido, lo compensan con pura valentía y compromiso.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

weapon->Shortsword.name: Shortsword
weapon->Shortsword.description: These blades come in a variety of shapes and styles, but they are typically 2 feet long.

armor->Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
armor->Leather Armor.description: A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Goblin Scuttle.name: Duende Scuttle
action->Goblin Scuttle.description: Si un aliado goblin finaliza una acción de movimiento adyacente al guerrero goblin, el guerrero puede usar su reacción para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step} .

Harpy (BB).name: Arpía (BB)
Harpy (BB).publicNotes: Harpies are an amalgamation of human and bird, using their ancestral control of the wind to lure prey or even directly pull in their next meal. Harpies can eat most creatures, but prefer to eat humans and elves in particular. Harpies live in family groups or larger clans, although they rarely hunt in big groups, preferring to keep most meals for themselves.

action->Stench.name: Hedor
action->Stench.description: A creature that comes within 30 feet of the harpy and can smell the harpy must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save. On a failure, the creature takes a -1 status penalty to all checks and DCs until it uses an action to retch. A creature that succeeds at its save isn't affected by any harpy's stenches for 1 minute.

action->Hungry Winds.name: Hungry Winds
action->Hungry Winds.description: The harpy uses the wind to pull its prey closer. A target within 20 feet must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be pulled adjacent to the harpy. The harpy then makes a jaws strike against the target. If the target is pulled into the air and cannot fly, it falls as normal.

Hell Hound (BB).name: Perro del infierno (BB)
Hell Hound (BB).publicNotes: Temperamentales y de comportamiento rápido y agresivo, los perros del infierno son caninos diabólicos de un plano infernal. Son hábiles cazadores y pueden exhalar llamas sobrenaturales de sus fauces. La apariencia de un sabueso del infierno no deja dudas sobre sus orígenes infernales: carne del color de la brea ardiente, dientes tan afilados como la horca de cualquier demonio y un sudario de fuego infernal siempre ardiendo son características distintivas. Aunque no pueden hablar, entienden el lenguaje Infernal del Infierno.

action->Hellfire Breath.name: Hellfire Breath
action->Hellfire Breath.description:
The hell hound breathes flames that deal @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[cone|distance:15]. Each affected creature must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic] save.

The hell hound can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Hellfire Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. If the hell hound would take fire damage or is the target of a fire effect, its Hellfire Breath recharges.

action->Pack Attack.name: Ataque de manada
action->Pack Attack.description: The hell hound's jaws Strike deals 1d4 extra damage to creatures within reach of two of the hell hounds' allies.

Hidden Pit (BB).name: Pozo escondido (BB)
Hidden Pit (BB).description: Una trampilla de madera cubre un pozo de 10 pies cuadrados que tiene 20 pies de profundidad.
Hidden Pit (BB).disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:12|traits:hazard|name:Remove the Trapdoor] para quitar la trampilla.
Hidden Pit (BB).stealth: (o @Check[type:perception|dc:0|traits:hazard] si la trampilla está inutilizada o rota)

action->Pitfall.name: Trampa
action->Pitfall.description: Si una criatura camina hacia la trampilla, esa criatura cae a menos que tenga éxito en una salvación @Check[type:reflex|dc:16] para agarrarse del borde. El pozo tiene 20 pies de profundidad y causa @Damage[10[bludgeoning]] daño a cualquiera que caiga al fondo.

Hobgoblin Soldier (BB).name: Hobgoblin Soldier (BB)
Hobgoblin Soldier (BB).publicNotes: Los hobgoblins son singularmente devotos de la guerra, y toda su civilización se basa en fomentar y mantener el conflicto y, al mismo tiempo, demostrar su superioridad en la batalla. Altamente organizados, trabajan eficiente y eficazmente en grupos, ya sea un pequeño grupo de asalto, una banda de guerra itinerante o un ejército completamente reglamentado. Físicamente, los hobgoblins son tan altos como los humanos y tienen la piel gris cenicienta.

weapon->Longsword.name: Longsword
weapon->Longsword.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.LJdbVTOZog39EEbi]

Las espadas largas pueden ser espadas de uno o dos filos. Sus hojas son pesadas y miden entre 3 y 4 pies de largo.

weapon->Shortbow.name: Shortbow
weapon->Shortbow.description: This smaller bow is made of a single piece of wood and favored by skirmishers and cavalry.

shield->Shield.name:
La etiqueta <Compendium> se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]
Blindaje
shield->Shield.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Yr9yCuJiAlFh3QEB]

Un escudo tiene 20 puntos de vida. Si un escudo alguna vez recibe 10 daños o más, se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3] {Roto} . Un escudo roto no se puede usar para @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm] {Raise a Shield} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8] {Shield Block} , pero aún puedes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME] {Repair}. Si el escudo pierde los 20 puntos de vida, queda completamente destruido.

armor->Breastplate.name: Breastplate
armor->Breastplate.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.pRoikbRo5HFW6YUB]{Half Plate} armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

consumable->Arrows.name: Arrows
consumable->Arrows.description: These projectiles are the ammunition for bows. The shaft of an arrow is made of wood. It is stabilized in flight by fletching at one end and bears a metal head on the other.

action->Formation.name: Formación
action->Formation.description: When they're adjacent to at least two other allies, the hobgoblin soldier gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and saving throws.

action->Shield Block.name: Shield Block
action->Shield Block.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.m4HQ2o5aPxjXf2kY]

Si @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm] {Raised a Shield} desde su último turno, el hobgoblin puede gastar su reacción para bloquear un Golpe. Reduce el daño en 5, pero el duende y el escudo reciben el daño restante, posiblemente @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3] {Breaking} o destruyen el escudo.

action->Twisting Tail.name: Twisting Tail
action->Twisting Tail.description: When a creature within 10 feet uses a move action or leaves a square during a move action it's using, the dragon can use their reaction to make a tail Strike at the creature with a -2 penalty. If it hits, the creature stops moving in the square it was in when the dragon used this reaction.

action->Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy
action->Draconic Frenzy.description: The dragon makes two claw Strikes and one tail Strike in any order.

action->Draconic Momentum.name: Draconic Momentum
action->Draconic Momentum.description: When the dragon gets a critical success on a Strike, they recharge their Poison Breath.

action->Poison Breath.name: Poison Breath
action->Poison Breath.description:
The dragon breathes a toxic cloud that deals @Damage[5d6[poison]] damage in a @Template[cone|distance:30]. Each creature in the area must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save.

The dragon can't use their Poison Breath again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Poison Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

spell->Command.name: Command
spell->Command.description:
You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay} or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Figment.name: Figment
spell->Figment.description:
You create a simple illusory sound or vision. A sound adds the auditory trait to the spell and the sound can't include intelligible words or elaborate music. A vision adds the visual trait, can be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and is clearly crude and undetailed if viewed from within 15 feet. When you Cast or Sustain the Spell, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} with the illusion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your Deception check. If the attempt fails against a creature, that creature disbelieves the figment.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.2Hg3a06gZCSnUgSA]{Spell Effect: Figment}

spell->Force Barrage.name: Force Barrage
spell->Force Barrage.description:
You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of shards you shoot by one, to a maximum of three shards for 3 actions. You choose the target for each shard individually. If you shoot more than one shard at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.

spell->Gouging Claw.name: Gouging Claw
spell->Gouging Claw.description:
You temporarily morph your limb into a clawed appendage. Make a melee spell attack roll against your target's AC. If you hit, you deal your choice of 2d6 slashing damage or 2d6 piercing damage, plus 2 persistent bleed damage. On a critical success, you deal double damage and double bleed damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6 and the persistent bleed damage increases by 1.

spell->Message.name: Message
spell->Message.description:
You mouth words quietly, but instead of coming out of your mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear your words any better than if you normally mouthed them, the target can hear your words as if they were standing next to you. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see you and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to your ear, just like the original message.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

weapon->Staff.name: Personal
weapon->Staff.description: Este largo trozo de madera puede ayudar a caminar y asestar un fuerte golpe.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description:
La etiqueta se reemplazará con el texto de la entrada del compendio @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.AWvNPE4U0kEJSL1T]

Zolgran causa 1d6 de daño adicional a las criaturas que tienen la condición @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido}.

Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB)
Kobold Dragon Mage (Black, BB).publicNotes: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

spell->Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
spell->Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal 2d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

weapon->Staff.name: Staff
weapon->Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

action->Scamper.name: Scamper
action->Scamper.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.

Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB).name: Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB)
Kobold Dragon Mage (Blue, BB).publicNotes: Kobolds are small, reptilian humanoids who are often seen in the service of more powerful creatures. They lurk in dark places, usually tunnels and mines. Kobold mages use magic to carry out their schemes, often in service of a dragon or other powerful creatures.

You shout a command that's hard to ignore. You can command the target to approach you, run away (as if it had the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition), release what it's holding, drop @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, or stand in place. It can't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay} or take any reactions until it has obeyed your command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as you command.

Critical Failure The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey your command.

Heightened (5th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

spell->Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
spell->Detect Magic.description:
You send out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. You receive no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. You can choose to ignore magic you're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of you and your allies.

You detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the rank of your detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

Heightened (3rd) You learn the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which you learn.

Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but you also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, you don't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

spell->Figment.name: Figment
spell->Figment.description: You create a simple illusory sound or vision. A sound adds the auditory trait to the spell and the sound can't include intelligible words or elaborate music. A vision adds the visual trait, can be no larger than a 5-foot cube, and is clearly crude and undetailed if viewed from within 15 feet. When you Cast or Sustain the Spell, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} with the illusion, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your Deception check. If the attempt fails against a creature, that creature disbelieves the figment.

spell->Force Barrage.name: Force Barrage
spell->Force Barrage.description:
You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action you use when Casting the Spell, increase the number of shards you shoot by one, to a maximum of three shards for 3 actions. You choose the target for each shard individually. If you shoot more than one shard at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.

spell->Force Barrage.name: Force Barrage
spell->Force Barrage.description:
You fire a shard of solidified magic toward a creature that you can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. Heightened (+2) You fire one additional shard with each action you spend.

spell->Shield.name: Shield
spell->Shield.description:
You raise a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.

While the spell is in effect, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} reaction with your magic shield. The shield has Hardness 5. You can use the spell's reaction to reduce damage from any spell or magical effect, even if it doesn't deal physical damage. After you use Shield Block, the spell ends and you can't cast it again for 10 minutes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Jemq5UknGdMO7b73]{Spell Effect: Shield}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.QF6RDlCoTvkVHRo4]{Effect: Shield Immunity}

Heightened (+2) The shield's Hardness increases by 5.

spell->Telekinetic Projectile.name: Telekinetic Projectile
spell->Telekinetic Projectile.description:
You hurl a loose, unattended object that is within range and that has 1 Bulk or less at the target. Make a spell attack roll against the target. If you hit, you deal 2d6 bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage—as appropriate for the object you hurled. No specific traits or magic properties of the hurled item affect the attack or the damage.

Critical Success You deal double damage.

Success You deal full damage.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

weapon->Staff.name: Staff
weapon->Staff.description: This long piece of wood can aid in walking and deliver a mighty blow.

action->Scamper.name: Scamper
action->Scamper.description: If the kobold is adjacent to at least one enemy, the kobold Strides up to 30 feet and gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against reactions triggered by this movement. The kobold must end this movement in a space that's not adjacent to any enemy.
